name: Bacterial Vaginosis
clinical_setting:
Causes vaginitis and cervicitis (Amsel's criteria = 3 of 4 of below; Nugent's criteria = vaginal gram stain)
Copious, malodorous, thin, milky vaginal discharge,
pH >4.5.
Whiff Test (fishy odor when10% Potassium Hydroxide added to vaginal discharge; ).
"Clue" Cell (epithelial cell coated with bacteria).
May be transmitted sexually but not a STD; no need to treat sexual partners unless balanitis is present.
diagnosis: NAAT tests based upon presence of above bacteria.

primary_regimens.dosage: 0.5 gm po bid x 7 days (DO NOT USE 2 gm po x one dose)
(1 applicator intravaginally) once daily x 5 days
primary_regimens.notes: 1 applicator contains 5 gm of gel with 37.5 mg Metronidazole

In randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial, the vaginal probiotic Lactin-V (Lactobacillus crispatus) reduced recurrence, week 12, from 45% in the placebo group to 30% in the Lactin-V patients, p 0.01. Lactin-V study regimen starting at the end of the metronidazole. Daily vaginal instillation daily x 4 days and then twice a week for 10 weeks. Ref: N Engl J Med. 2020;382:1906.

primary_regimens.dosage: 2% vaginal cream 5 gm intravaginally at bedtime x 7 days

alternative_regimens.dosage: (2 gm po once daily x 2 days or 1 gm po once daily x 5 days)
100 mg intravaginally at bedtime x 3 days
one dose of 2 gm packet of granules with yogurt, applesauce or pudding over 30 minutes
alternative_regimens.notes: Clinical response in 68% of patients treated with secnidazole vs 18% of placebo patients

comments: See 2021 CDC STD Guidelines: MMWR Recomm Rep 70 (RR-4):1 2021
Metronidazole and tinidazole do not induce acetaldehyde dehydrogenase and data to support disulfiram reactions with alcohol consumption are not strong Antimicrob Agents Chemother 64:e02167 2020
2021 CDC STI guidelines no longer recommend avoidance of alcohol when receiving metronidazole for treatment of Trichomonas or bacterial vaginosis Clin Inf Dis 74:S152 2022
Pathogenesis is complex and incompletely understood: J Infect Dis 2016;214 (supplement S1): S1-S5
Reported 50% increase in cure rate if patient abstains from sex or uses condoms, Clin Infect Dis 44:213, 2007 & Clin Infect Dis 44:220, 2007.
Metronidazole extended release tabs 750 mg po q24h x 7 days are available, but no published data.

Pregnancy: Metronidazole or Clindamycin oral 7-day regimens, see Canadian Ob/Gyn practice guidelines in J Obstet Gynecol Can 30:702, 2008. US preventive services task force recommends NOT screening for bacterial vaginosis in pregnancy (JAMA 2020; 323:1286)
